abbreviation for Smart Export Guarantee: an arrangement by which companies in the UK that supply electricity pay customers for extra renewable electricity those customers have produced and returned to the National Grid (= a system of special wires that take electricity from power stations to all parts of a country): There are no set or minimum tariffs for the SEG. To start receiving accurate SEG payments, it's likely that you'll need to get a smart meter installed.
More examplesFewer examplesBig energy companies have had to participate in the SEG since the beginning of 2020.All energy suppliers with 150,000 or more customers must provide at least one SEG tariff. A fixed SEG tariff will pay a determined rate per kWh of electricity exported over the length of the contract.
